name: Hotel Tomo, a Joie de Vivre hotel

reviews.text: I just returned from a week-long stay, and if the room hadn't been pre-paid by the company, I would have checked out after the second day. The air conditioner blew hot air. The staff was very accomodating and were moved to a different room, in which the air worked. Unfortunately there was a bad leak from the air unit over the sink in the bathroom. So I was moved again. None of the subsequent rooms (there were six in all) had a functioning air conditioner.
reviews.title: Staff was awesome, rooms were horrible

reviews.text: The staff tried very hard to accomodate me, but was very limited by the aged condition of the building.
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.text: Nice little hotel, very clean and close to Fillmore street which has great night life and a lot of restaurants.
reviews.title: one of the best deals you can find in SF

reviews.text: I loved the room decorations with Japanese art twist.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is a total satisfaction for the rates it charges.. everything from the lobby to the rooms make you feel good about staying here. the rooms are spacious w comfy beds and are good design. located in the japanese district it really has a hip and distinct character.
reviews.title: Cool pad

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I stayed there for one night in Mid-September. The rooms are adorable-very Hello Kittyish,clean, & balcony was nice. The air conditioner did not work, which is usually not an issue in San Francisco, but it happened to be very warm. The beds were comfy, but the vanity area was small. Overall, nice place. The bar and restaurant were very good. Parking is difficult, but the front desk staff were very nice.
reviews.title: Fun Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of SFO.
reviews.title: All what you need

reviews.text: Rooms are nice and clean,
reviews.title: Rooms good, staff unhelpful and rude

reviews.text: the lady manager is so sweet and nice… the Male manager at the early A.M. is a non friendly man.. maybe cause he wakes up early :)
reviews.title: This hotel was awful - I won't be coming back

reviews.text: parking is always full, but since you pay for it, they have to let you in..
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Myself and a friend stayed at Hotel Tomo in early October. Check-in was very easy and we were able to check in to our room at around 2:00. The room was clean, but they were having issues with the air conditioning system that weekend and it was bit too warm. The city was cutting down tree limbs down the street and so we had a rude awakening at 6:00 the first morning. Gill was very helpful in having us moved to another room which was higher up and faced the back courtyard. The air conditioner worked great in this room and there was no street noise. The staff was very helpful and efficient whether it was calling cabs or storing luggage. The location is close to some great restaurants (we particularly enjoyed Sweet Maple and Woodhouse Fish Co.) and within short cab rides to most of the touristy areas of SF. I would certainly stay here again on a future trip to SF!
reviews.title: Nice staff and nice location

reviews.text: This was our second stay here, the third in Japantown. The area is centrally located and easier to manuever from than Fisherman's Wharf (by car). Great breakfast spots around Fillmore Street. Parking is tight, but it is San Francisco. Staff will work with you. AC is a bit of an issue, but again its San Francisco. If you don't need five star comfort, this is a great place to stay. Feel more like you live there than a tourist!
reviews.title: Quiet, moderately priced for San Francisco.

reviews.text: Far from the madding crowds of Union Square and Nob Hill is the relatively tranquil calm of Japantown, which appears to be comprised of a sizeable Japanese shopping/dining pavilion surrounded by various structures vaguely resembling traditional Japanese buildings. Right on the edge of Japantown is a blocky, almost brutalistic Best Western Hotel circa the late 1960s/early 1970s, complete with popcorn ceilings and metal doors. But it seems that someone came up with the brilliant idea to go way left of center with the inevitable renovation. Rather than aspiring to some kind of zen retreat ala the nearby Kabuki Hotel, why not do something cheap but fun? Instead of dark stained ebony, use knotty pine. Instead of images of geishas and crashing waves, why not channel kitschy Harajuku and manga fabulousity? The result is something that is less Akira Kurosawa and more Akira, the animated manga movie. The Hotel TOMO! was born.
reviews.title: Domo arigato, Hot-el TOMO!

reviews.text: The room itself was very large, especially by San Francisco standards, and was quite comfortable and stylish, including a flat screen TV, a hanging George Nelson ball lamp and free wi-fi. The restaurant served Japanese-style fare (big surprise, I know), and in typical Japanese fashion, the portions were tiny but tasty. The "exercise room" on the fourth floor was nothing but a few treadmills. If you are looking for a real workout, take a brisk walk over to 24-hour Fitness on Van Ness.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a business trip. The room itself was clean; however, the furniture seemed cheap and the art was creepy. My sheets had a hole in them. On my first morning, a housekeeper barged in my room, even though I had the "do not disturb" sign on the door.
reviews.title: We've been staying here since the '80s

reviews.text: what a great value. The rooms were fun, great for me and my 9 year old daughter. the location was not that great, but we rode the bus and where we needed to all around town. The front desk staff and housekeeping staff was very friendly. the japanese mall just south of the hotel was very inexpensive. the restaurants were a good value. I chose this hotel for its price point in being in the trip advisor top 50 of 250 hotels in san francisco. It was a great choice. I would highly recommend hotel tomo.
reviews.title: I was really impressed!

reviews.text: Nice hotel and useful location close to Fillmore Street where if you head north from Sutter Street there is a nice selection of cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: Very good hotel and location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is bright and cheerful with Manga style decor in the rooms and lobby. The rooms themselves are a nice size and very comfortable. The only negative comment I have is that the ice machine on the third floor is noisy enough to be intrusive if you're a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Great Location --

reviews.text: The wireless network was variable but the hotel reception lent me an Ethernet lead to plug into the fixed network which worked perfectly.
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel particularly to families.
reviews.title: Good hotel
